name: In re Beechwood Avenue. Appeal of John P. Ober

judges: Before Sterbett, C. J., Green, McCollum, Mitchell, Dean, Fell and Brown, JJ.
parties: In re Beechwood Avenue. Appeal of John P. Ober.

opinions.text:
Opinion by
Mr. Chief Justice Sterrett,
This is one of five appeals from the decree in Beechwood avenue, dismissing exceptions and confirming the report of viewers, all of which involved substantially the same questions and were argued together.
For reasons given in an opinion just filed in one of said cases, viz: Roger O’Mara’s Appeal, ante, p. 86, the decree in this case is affirmed and appeal dismissed at appellant’s costs.
opinions.author: Mr. Chief Justice Sterrett,

casebody.head_matter:
In re Beechwood Avenue. Appeal of John P. Ober.
Dec. 30, 1899:
Argued Oct. 26, 1899.
Appeal, No. 106, Oct. T., 1899, by John P. Ober, from order of C. P. No. 3, Allegheny Co., Nov. T., 1898, No. 262, overruling exceptions to report of viewers.
Before Sterbett, C. J., Green, McCollum, Mitchell, Dean, Fell and Brown, JJ.
Affirmed.
